dt: {bc}the function or vocation of a prophet
{bc}the inspired declaration of divine will and purpose

et: Middle English {it}prophecie, prophesie,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French, borrowed from Late Latin {it}prophētīa,{/it} borrowed from Greek {it}prophēteía{/it} "gift of interpreting the will of the gods, interpretation of a god's will," (New Testament) "gift of speaking, preaching and expounding scripture under the Holy Spirit's influence," from {it}prophḗtēs{/it} {et_link|prophet|prophet} + {it}-ia{/it} {et_link|-ia:1|-ia:1}
shortdef: an inspired utterance of a prophet
the function or vocation of a prophet; specifically : the inspired declaration of divine will and purpose
a prediction of something to come
